page.title: 05Worsley Hall Farm
page.content: Worsley Hall Farm is near to the Old Hall. It was originally used as a stud farm for the Old Hall. The farm covers 240 acres. It has 200 cows which are fattened up and slaughtered. 400 sheep are also kept. The lambs are slaughtered when they are a few weeks old. Mr Fitton owns 10 horses of his own and has stables which he hires out. Barley and hay are grown to feed the animals. Mr Fitton runs the farm, Bridgewater Estates owns it. In July Mr Fitton buys turkeys to be fatteden up for Christmas. He kills them and plucks them himself. Cattle are fed cattlenuts as well as barley and hay. The farm will be smaller in the future as houses are to be built on the other side of the East Lancs Road.
